Package ohos.agp.components

Class ScrollHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.components.ScrollHelper

  • public class ScrollHelper
extends Object
    Provides methods of obtaining animation values of a scrolling or sliding component.

    The animation values include the scrolling distance, whether the scrolling ends, speed of throwing the animation, and speed of accelerating and decelerating the animation.

    Since:
    3

    • Method Detail

      • doFling

        public void doFling​(int startX,
                    int startY,
                    int velocityX,
                    int velocityY,
                    int minX,
                    int maxX,
                    int minY,
                    int maxY)
        Starts flinging the content.

        This method is also used to set the fling speed and distance.

        Parameters:
        startX - Indicates the X-axis coordinate of the start point to fling.
        startY - Indicates the Y-axis coordinate of the start point to fling.
        velocityX - Indicates the initial velocity on X-axis, in unit of pixels per second. The value can be negative, indicating that the component is slowing down.
        velocityY - Indicates the initial velocity on the Y-axis, in unit of pixels per second. The value can be negative, indicating that the component is slowing down.
        minX - Indicates the minimum fling distance on X-axis.
        maxX - Indicates the maximum fling distance on X-axis.
        minY - Indicates the minimum fling distance on Y-axis.
        maxY - Indicates the maximum fling distance on Y-axis.
        Since:
        4

      • doFlingX

        public void doFlingX​(int startX,
                     int velocityX,
                     int minX,
                     int maxX)
        Starts flinging along the x axis.

        You can also use this method to set the fling velocity and distance.

        Parameters:
        startX - Indicates the x coordinate where flinging starts.
        velocityX - Indicates the number of pixels moved on the x axis per second.
        minX - Indicates the minimum flinging distance on the x axis.
        maxX - Indicates the maximum flinging distance on the x axis.
        Since:
        4

      • doFlingY

        public void doFlingY​(int startY,
                     int velocityY,
                     int minY,
                     int maxY)
        Starts flinging along the y axis.

        You can also use this method to set the fling velocity and distance.

        Parameters:
        startY - Indicates the y coordinate where flinging starts.
        velocityY - Indicates the number of pixels moved on the y axis per second.
        minY - Indicates the minimum flinging distance on the y axis.
        maxY - Indicates the maximum flinging distance on the y axis.
        Since:
        4

      • startScrollX

        public void startScrollX​(int startX,
                         int dx)
        Starts scrolling along the x axis.
        Parameters:
        startX - Indicates the x coordinate where scrolling starts.
        dx - Indicates the scrolling distance on the x axis. A positive value indicates scrolling leftwards, and a negative value indicates scrolling rightwards.
        Since:
        4

      • startScrollY

        public void startScrollY​(int startY,
                         int dy)
        Starts scrolling along the y axis.
        Parameters:
        startY - Indicates the y coordinate where scrolling starts.
        dy - Indicates the scrolling distance on the y axis. A positive value indicates scrolling upwards, and a negative value indicates scrolling downwards.
        Since:
        4

        public int getFlingDistanceX​(int velocityX)
        Obtains the flinging distance on the x axis.
        Parameters:
        velocityX - Indicates the number of pixels per second (px/s) on the x axis.
        Returns:
        Returns the flinging distance.
        Since:

        Returns:
        Returns the flinging distance.
        Since:
        4

        public int getFlingVelocityX​()
        Obtains the flinging velocity on the x axis.

      • startScroll

        public void startScroll​(int startX,
                        int startY,
                        int dx,
                        int dy)
        Starts scrolling the content a component.
        Parameters:
        startX - Indicates the X-axis coordinate of the start point to scroll.
        startY - Indicates the Y-axis coordinate of the start point to scroll.
        dx - Indicates the scrolling distance on X-axis. If the value is positive, the content scrolls to the left. If the value is negative, the content scrolls to the right.
        dy - Indicates the scrolling distance on Y-axis. If the value is positive, the content scrolls up. If the value is negative, the content scrolls down.

      • getHorizontalBeginPosition

        public int getHorizontalBeginPosition​()
        Obtains the x coordinate where scrolling starts.
        Returns:
        Returns the x coordinate.
        Since:
        4

      • getCurrValue

        public int getCurrValue​(int direction)
        Obtains the X/Y-axis coordinate during scrolling or flinging.
        Parameters:
        direction - Indicate x-axis or y-axis.
        Returns:
        Returns the current X/Y-axis coordinate.
        Since:

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished​()
        Determines whether scrolling or flinging is finished.
        Returns:
        Returns true if scrolling or flinging is finished; returns false otherwise.

      • setFriction

        public void setFriction​(float friction)
        Sets the amount of simulated friction to calculate the current speed. A greater amount of friction indicates faster speed deceleration.
        Parameters:
        friction - Indicates the amount of friction.

      • getFriction

        public float getFriction​()
        Obtains the amount of friction. The friction is used to calculate the current speed. A greater amount of friction indicates faster speed deceleration.
        Returns:
        Returns the set or default friction.

      • abortAnimation

        public void abortAnimation​()
        Stops an animation by stopping the calculation of the animation position.

      • updateScroll

        public boolean updateScroll​()
        Updates the position of a flinging or scrolling animation.

        After the animation position is updated, the animation update result is returned.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the animation is updated; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • getCurrVelocity

        public float getCurrVelocity​()
        Obtains the current velocity.
        Returns:
        Returns the current velocity.

      • isOverScrolled

        public boolean isOverScrolled​()
        Checks whether the content has scrolled to a valid position.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the content has scrolled to a valid position; returns false otherwise.
